trans-unit.source: Declaratively instructs the .NET Framework to perform time validation on a configuration property.
This class cannot be inherited.
You use the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute> attribute to decorate a configuration property.
This is to instruct the .NET Framework to validate the property using the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> class and pass to it the value of the decorating parameters.
You can apply <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute> objects to property types only.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute"></xref> class.
You use this constructor in the attributed model to ensure that the type of the value assigned to the related property is a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include or exclude the integers in the range as defined by <xref href="System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MinValueString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MaxValueString"></xref>.
The range is inclusive of the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MinValueString%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MaxValueString%2A> properties.
When the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.ExcludeRange%2A> property is `false`, the allowed values are outside the range.
`true` if the value must be excluded; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets the absolute maximum <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value.
This is the absolute maximum value allowed by the .NET Framework.
Its value is defined by the <xref:System.TimeSpan.MaxValue> field.
The allowed maximum <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value.
Gets or sets the relative maximum <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value.
This is the relative maximum value as set by the user.
The allowed maximum <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value.
The selected value represents less than <xref href="System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MinValue"></xref>.
Gets the absolute minimum <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value.
This is the absolute minimum value allowed by the .NET Framework.
Its value is defined by the <xref:System.TimeSpan.MinValue> field.
The allowed minimum <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value.
Gets or sets the relative minimum <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value.
This is the relative minimum value as set by the user.
The minimum allowed <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value.
The selected value represents more than <xref href="System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MaxValue"></xref>.
Gets the absolute maximum value allowed.
The string that contains the maximum allowed value for the time interval.
Gets the absolute minimum value allowed.
The string that contains the minimum allowed value for the time interval.
Gets an instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator"></xref> class.

You use the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.ValidatorInstance%2A> property to perform string validation by calling its <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorBase"></xref> validator instance.
